intro: Pedicularis porrecta, commonly known as the common lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. This herbaceous plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are arranged in a spike-like inflorescence. The plant is characterized by its reduced leaves and specialized structures that facilitate its parasitic lifestyle.
